did.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee Employment and Training Institute, 1976-2015

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. Employment and Training Institute

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: Records of the Employment and Training Institute (ETI), a research center in the School of Continuing Education which addresses the needs of unemployed and underemployed Wisconsin workers and families. The collection is comprised of education and employment publications on GED assessments, post-secondary education and employment for GED and Milwaukee Public School (MPS) graduates, and the labor market and AFDC single-parent employment in Milwaukee. Also included in the collection are job opening and job seeker surveys and news clippings on MPS desegregation and national and local race, labor, and education issues.

bioghist.p: The Employment and Training Institute (ETI) was established in 1978 by the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and the University of Wisconsin-Extension to address the educational and training needs of unemployed and underemployed Wisconsin workers and families. ETI was established as part of UW-Extension's implementation of the "Wisconsin Idea", which indicates university research should be applied to solve problems and improve the quality of life for all Wisconsin citizens. ETI addressed the educational and employment needs of youth and adults through research and community education.

scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection contains research and training publications produced between 1980 and 2003. Publications include GED and MPS graduate employment and post-secondary education readiness, juvenile ex-offender and youth employment, Metropolitian Milwaukee job opening surveys, and Milwaukee County educational and employment guide and single parent AFDC population and employment earnings. The collection also contains local news clippings from 1976 on MPS desegregation, and national and local news clippings on racism, neighborhood segregation, youth and adult employment, GED assessments, youth education, and welfare reform.

arrangement.p: The collection is organized into three series:
The files are organized alphabetically by subject, then chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

archref.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee Center for Urban Community Development Records

phystech.p: The records in the Web Archives Series were collected using the Archive-It Web Archiving tool.

accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials, and the collection is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: The Employment and Training Institute Collection was transferred to the Archives by Lois Quinn as part of accession 2016-036 in February 2017.

processinfo.p: Phyllis Reske minimally processed accession 2016-036 in March 2017.

separatedmaterial.head: Deaccession Information
separatedmaterial.p: One box of publications received as part of accession 2016-036 was removed from the collection and added to the Milwaukee Urban Observatory Collection (UWM Archival Collection 73).

scopecontent.p: Home Page of the the Employment and Training Institute, including a majority of their publications from 1976-2016. The links to the Labor Market Drilldowns on the Publications page are active, but do not properly link to the drilldown database; most other publications have been captured.

acqinfo.p: Web crawling is managed through the Internet Archive's Archive-It service. This series includes links to both the university's collection and the Internet Archive's public collection.

Web records from UWM are collected on a semi-annual basis. Crawls of the UWM Web Site may be performed at more frequent intervals in cases of major events, significant additions or changes to the UWM Website or the websites of schools and colleges, etc. Social Media feeds are crawled on an as-requested basis.

phystech.p: Web Archives collected by the Internet Archives Wayback Machine and Archive-It Web Harvesting Tools.
